item.title: R-Ladies Freiburg year-end Meetup
item.description:
I’m happy to deliver a talk about my journey into the development of the covid19tunisia R package on Tuesday, December 1st, 2020!

Thank you R-Ladies Freiburg for organizing such a meetup.

Please find in the following link my slides.

item.title: R-Ladies Tunis
item.description:
R-Ladies Tunis is a local chapter of R-Ladies Global, an organization that promotes gender diversity in the R community worldwide.

We are a group of Tunisian ladies passionate about R programming. We are from different backgrounds : data scientists, business analysts, bioinformaticians, biostatisticians, etc.

We aim meetup in person or virtually to learn about the R programming language, algorithms and advanced tools using R. You might keep an eye out for our Meetup group.

Our priority is to provide a safe community space for anyone identifying as a minority gender who is interested in working with R.

We exchange materials, discuss any issues we have on working with R, and receive news and updates about R. We are really a part of great community. More details here

Please find below a list of the previous and upcoming meetups organized by R-Ladies Tunis. You are welcome to join us!

Upcoming events

üìÖ Friday, November 13, 2020

Statistical Analysis Tools of Complex Time-Series Data

We are delighted to come together with you to host another online meetup : Statistical Analysis Tools of Complex Time-Series Data.

‚ñ∂Ô∏è Invited speaker : Pr. Fa√Øcel Chamroukhi

‚ñ∂Ô∏è About Pr. Fa√Øcel Chamroukhi https://chamroukhi.com :

Fa√Øcel Chamroukhi is Professor of Statistics & Data Science in Caen, currently Adjunct Visiting Professor at La Trobe University and has been Assistant and Associate Professor of Computer Science and Machine Learning in Paris 13 and Toulon. He is broadly interested in the mathematical and algorithmic foundations of data science and AI, with a keen focus on modern statistics and machine learning. Common threads of his research include statistical modeling and inference, latent variable models, and learning in high-dimensional and large-scale scenario.

‚è∞ 6:30PM - 8PM (GMT+1)

üìç Zoom platform

üëâ Registration : In order to attend the event, please fill out this Google form.

Those who fill out the form will receive an email shortly with instructions on how to join. Additionally you will get reminders right before the workshop with the link so you have it handy.
